meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or fooled.
meanings.sent1: The poor dupe fell for the scam and lost all his money.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a dupe when she saw the truth.
meanings.sent3: The dupe thought the fake lottery ticket was real and celebrated too soon.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a dupe when he discovered the truth behind the magic trick.
meanings.sent5: The dupe's trusting nature made him an easy target for con artists.

meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone into believing something that is not true.
meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to dupe the old lady into buying a fake painting.
meanings.sent2: She managed to dupe him into revealing his secret plan.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy tried to dupe his friends into thinking he had superpowers.
meanings.sent4: The fake website was designed to dupe unsuspecting customers into giving away their personal information.
meanings.sent5: The clever disguise was meant to dupe the guards and allow the thief to escape unnoticed.

meanings.sent1: She didn't realize she was being duped until it was too late.
meanings.sent2: He felt embarrassed after being duped by the fake news article.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to dupe the dog into thinking it had already eaten all the treats.
meanings.sent4: The clever magician duped the audience with his amazing illusions.
meanings.sent5: The fake psychic managed to dupe many people into believing her predictions were real.
